{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[312]] &ndash; [[Constantine the Great]] is said to have received his famous [[Battle of Milvian Bridge#Vision of Constantine|Vision of the Cross]].
* [[710]] &ndash; [[Saracen]] invasion of [[Sardinia]].
* [[939]] &ndash; [[Edmund I of England|Edmund I]] succeeds [[Athelstan of England|Athelstan]] as [[King of England]].
*[[1275]] &ndash; Traditional founding of the city of [[Amsterdam]].
*[[1524]] &ndash; [[Italian Wars]]: The French troops lay siege to [[Pavia]].
*[[1553]] &ndash; Condemned as a [[Heresy|heretic]], [[Michael Servetus]] is [[burned at the stake]] just outside [[Geneva]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[Second Battle of Newbury]] in the [[English Civil War]].
*[[1682]] &ndash; [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]] is founded.
*[[1795]] &ndash; The [[United States]] and [[Spain]] sign the [[Treaty of Madrid (1795)|Treaty of Madrid]], which establishes the boundaries between [[Spanish colonization of the Americas|Spanish colonies]] and the U.S.
*[[1806]] &ndash; The [[French Army]] enters [[Berlin]], following the [[Battle of Jena]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[United States]] annexes the former [[Spanish colonization of the Americas|Spanish colony]] of [[West Florida]].
*[[1827]] &ndash; [[Vincenzo Bellini|Bellini]]'s third opera [[Il pirata]] is premiered at [[Teatro alla Scala di Milano]]
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Missouri]] governor [[Lilburn Boggs]] issues the [[Extermination Order (Mormonism)|Extermination Order]], which orders all [[Mormons]] to leave the state or be exterminated.
*[[1870]] &ndash; Marshal [[François Achille Bazaine]] surrenders to [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] forces at the conclusion of the [[Siege of Metz (1870)|Siege of Metz]] along with 140,000 [[France|French]] soldiers in one of the biggest French defeats of the [[Franco-Prussian War]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; The first underground [[New York City Subway]] line opens; the system becomes the biggest in [[United States]], and one of the biggest in world.
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Černová massacre]]: Fifteen people are killed in the [[Lands of the Crown of Saint Stephen|Hungarian half]] of [[Austria-Hungary]] when a gunman opens fire on a crowd gathered at a church consecration. This would led to protests over the treatment of minorities in Austria-Hungary. 
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The British super-[[dreadnought]] battleship [[HMS Audacious (1912)|HMS Audacious]] (23,400 tons), is sunk off [[Tory Island]], north-west of [[Ireland]], by a [[naval mine|minefield]] laid by the armed German merchant-cruiser ''Berlin''.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Battle of Segale]]: Negus Mikael, marching on the [[Ethiopia]]n capital in support of his son Emperor [[Iyasu V of Ethiopia|Iyasus V]], is defeated by Fitawrari abte Giyorgis, securing the throne for Empress [[Zauditu of Ethiopia|Zauditu]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; A referendum in [[Rhodesia]] rejects the country's annexation to the [[South African Union]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic|Uzbek SSR]] is founded in the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; Ratifications exchanged in London for the first [[London Naval Treaty]], signed in April modifying the 1925 [[Washington Naval Treaty]] and the [[treaty|arms limitation treaty]]'s modified provisions, go into effect immediately, further limiting the expensive naval arms race among its five signatories.
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Wallis, The Duchess of Windsor|Mrs Wallis Simpson]] files for [[divorce]] which would eventually allow her to marry King [[Edward VIII of the United Kingdom]], thus forcing his [[Edward VIII abdication crisis|abdication]] from the throne.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Wehrmacht|German forces]] capture [[Banská Bystrica]] during [[Slovak National Uprising]] thus bringing it to an end.
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Léopold Sédar Senghor]] founds the [[Senegalese Democratic Bloc]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; British [[Operation Totem|nuclear test]] ''Totem 2'' is carried out at [[Emu Field]], [[South Australia]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Benjamin O. Davis Jr.]] becomes the first [[African-American]] general in the [[United States Air Force]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Iskander Mirza]], the first [[President of Pakistan]], is deposed in a bloodless [[coup d'état]] by General [[Ayub Khan (Field Marshal)|Ayub Khan]], who had been appointed the enforcer of [[martial law]] by Mirza 20 days earlier.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[NASA]] tests the first [[Saturn I]] [[rocket]] in [[SA-1 (Apollo)|Mission Saturn-Apollo 1]].
*  1961   &ndash; [[Mauritania]] and [[Mongolia]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; Major [[Rudolf Anderson]] of the [[United States Air Force]] becomes the only direct human casualty of the [[Cuban Missile Crisis]] when his [[Lockheed U-2|U-2 reconnaissance airplane]] is shot down in [[Cuba]] by a Soviet-supplied [[SA-2 Guideline]] [[surface-to-air missile]].
*  1962   &ndash; A plane carrying [[Enrico Mattei]], post-war Italian administrator, crashes in mysterious circumstances.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Ronald Reagan]] delivers a speech on behalf of Republican candidate for president, [[Barry Goldwater]]. The speech launched his political career and came to be known as "[[A Time for Choosing]]".
*[[1967]] &ndash; Catholic priest [[Philip Berrigan]] and others of the ''Baltimore Four'' protest the Vietnam War by pouring blood on [[Selective Service]] records.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] is renamed [[Zaire]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Cañon City, Colorado|Cañon City]] meteorite, a 1.4 [[kilogram|kg]] chondrite type [[meteorite]], strikes in [[Fremont County, Colorado]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] gains its independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] submarine [[Soviet submarine S-363|''U 137'']] runs aground on the east coast of [[Sweden]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom|British]] government suddenly deregulates financial markets, leading to a total restructuring of the way in which they operate in the country, in an event now referred to as the [[Big Bang (financial markets)|Big Bang]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Ronald Reagan]] decides to tear down the new U.S. Embassy in Moscow because of Soviet listening devices in the building structure.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Turkmenistan]] achieves independence from the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[United States Navy]] [[radioman]] [[Allen R. Schindler, Jr.]] is brutally murdered by shipmate Terry M. Helvey for being gay, precipitating first military, then national, debate about [[gays in the military]] that resulted in the United States "[[Don't ask, don't tell]]" military policy.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Gliese 229B]] is the first Substellar Mass Object to be unquestionably identified.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Latvia]] applies for membership in the [[European Union]].
*  1995   &ndash; Former [[Prime Minister of Italy]] [[Bettino Craxi]] is [[trial in absentia|convicted ''in absentia'']] of [[Political corruption|corruption]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[October 27, 1997 mini-crash]]: [[Stock market]]s around the world [[stock market crash|crash]] because of fears of a global economic meltdown. The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] plummets 554.26 points to 7,161.15.
*[[1999]] &ndash; Gunmen [[1999 Armenian parliament shooting|open fire]] in the [[Armenia]]n Parliament, killing Prime Minister [[Vazgen Sargsyan]], Parliament Chairman [[Karen Demirchyan]], and 6 other members.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[2005 Paris suburb riots|Riots begin in Paris]] after the deaths of two [[Muslim]] teenagers.
* 2011 – [[Michael D. Higgins]] was chosen in the [[Irish presidential election, 2011|Irish presidential election]] as the ninth [[President of Ireland]] by the biggest vote in Irish history.
